New Records: Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh's unbeaten partnership of 190 runs is the highest T20I partnership for any wicket for India.
Rohit Sharma's 121* is the highest score for an Indian captain in T20Is and the fourth-highest individual score for India in T20Is.
India posted the highest total for a team after being four down for 25 or less, reaching 212/4.
Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh scored 36 runs in the final over, tying the record for most runs scored in an over in T20Is.
First-ever double Super Over in an international match.
Rohit Sharma and Rinku Singh's unbeaten partnership of 190 runs is the highest for any side at 5th wicket or below in T20Is.
India now have 9 whitewash series wins in T20I cricket, the most by any country.
Rohit Sharma holds the record for scoring the most runs as an Indian captain in T20Is, surpassing Virat Kohli.
Rohit Sharma is the second captain after Babar Azam to hit three T20I centuries as the captain of the team.
Rohit Sharma equaled MS Dhoni's record of winning 42 T20Is for India.
Rohit Sharma has the most bilateral T20I series wins for India as captain, with 12.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 121 runs off 69 balls with 11 fours and eight sixes.
Rinku Singh played an unbeaten knock of 69 runs from 39 balls with two fours and six sixes.
India scored 36 runs in the final over of the match.
India and Afghanistan tied the match, leading to a double Super Over, which India won by 10 runs.
